docs.snippet: Patrick Marber’s circular comedy about male menopause gets the better of all the talented people involved in trying to make it seem fresh....
docs.lead_paragraph: Patrick Marber’s circular comedy about male menopause gets the better of all the talented people involved in trying to make it seem fresh.

headline.main: A Kvetch de Coeur From the Abyss of Middle Age
headline.print_headline: A Kvetch de Coeur From the Abyss of Middle Age

docs.snippet: Ready or not, the first Oscar-worthy performance of the year....
docs.lead_paragraph: "Oscar. Oscar," everyone murmured last night after watching Marion Cotillard's performance as Edith Piaf in "La Vie en Rose," which opened the Film Society of Lincoln Center's annual Rendez-Vous With French Cinema series at Alice Tully Hall.
docs.abstract: Ready or not, the first Oscar-worthy performance of the year.

docs.snippet: Leftover wish lists from this year's Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger posted a post-Oscar wish list of lovely things gone missing in the nominations and the commentators checked in with quite a few more. On their collective nominees wish list: Clive Owen in "Children of Men," "Children of Men" in general, Shareeka Epps, for her incandescent performance in "Half Nelson" (which won her a Spirit Award).
docs.abstract: Leftover wish lists from this year's Oscars.

docs.snippet: Another satisfied customer of the Carpetbagger....
docs.lead_paragraph: In amidst all the clutter, you might have missed the Bagger's Lincoln Log post-Oscar story, a little number that Movie City News billed thusly:
docs.abstract: Another satisfied customer of the Carpetbagger.

headline.main: A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Insolence

docs.snippet: The rare Oscar Ninny who is both emotionally engaged and sane....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger is a bit autistic when it comes to feelings about film awards, but it is a given of Oscar Ninnyism that many of the best sources have an emotional connection to the awards. Daniel Kenealy of OscarWatch, for example, throws his bit into a thicket of post-hoc Oscar deconstructions and manages to generate some heat and light. And he lays off the psycho rants from last year, so all the better.
docs.abstract: The rare Oscar Ninny who is both emotionally engaged and sane.

docs.snippet: If you hated this year's Oscars, this is the columnist for you....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nikke Finke opens up a can of bile on the Oscar show and then filets and serves up her own spleen. Here's one of the kinder passages:
docs.abstract: If you hated this year's Oscars, this is the columnist for you.

headline.main: Clubbing a Baby Penguin to Death

docs.snippet: Paul Verhoeven makes Hollywood sci-fi epics for a living, but he's still a Dutchman at heart....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baguette agrees with the Bagger that "Volver" should have gotten more love from the Academy. She's sweet on Pedro Almodovar, one of the few directors who genuinely loves and understands women. As he told the Baguette back in September, he finds women "more fascinating than men."
docs.abstract: Paul Verhoeven makes Hollywood sci-fi epics for a living, but he's still a Dutchman at heart.

headline.main: He Lives in L.A., but His Heart Is Still in Holland

docs.snippet: Senator McCain hits the trading floor of the Merc Exchange; Senator Obama may get federal approval to opt back in to public financing system....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator John McCain's campaign just announced that he'll participate in a press availability on the trading floor of the New York Mercantile Exchange this afternoon. He's in New York attending an Irish-Americans awards dinner tonight with the Women's National Republican Club.
docs.abstract: Senator McCain hits the trading floor of the Merc Exchange; Senator Obama may get federal approval to opt back in to public financing system.

docs.snippet: It was a good show, but it coulda been a great one. The bagger's thoughts on what might have been....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even though the Bagger is filled the brim by his Oscar experience -- he's been spontaneously doing that little penguin dance for the past few days -- there were a couple of things missing from this season. Coulda, woulda, shoulda? Sure, but this would have been an even better Oscar season with some of these elements.
docs.abstract: It was a good show, but it coulda been a great one. The bagger's thoughts on what might have been.
